alert.note: Alert for Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 4:07AM CDT until July 12 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHERN OUACHITA COUNTY... At 407 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen since midnight...with the heaviest rainfall across far southwest Ouachita county south of Stephens. Rainfall continues across these same areas. As a result...flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stephens, Louann, Buena Vista, Elliot, Kirkland, Frenchport, Troy, Cross Roads in Ouachita County, Standard Umpstead and Millers Bluff. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
